lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, picking up where we left off, Vox Machina, having to find and collect the artifacts known as the Vestiges of Divergence to prepare themselves for battle against the Chroma Conclave, a group of extremely dangerous chromatic dragons who are wreaking havoc on the Tal'Dorei countryside, and get vengeance for the loss of Vex and Vax's father in the past. Er, sorry, mother. The father's still around, and kind of a dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been a long week. However, you guys have been making your way into the Feywild in search of a specific item known as Fenthras, a bow of which Vex has been sort of keeping an eye on this whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnomes, making their way towards via Vex's broom, caught a partial glimpse of the creature that lived within, a door was suddenly opened, and upon floating back, the broom was robbed of its magical enchantment temporarily. The party regathered and are now deciding what to do here in the depths of the Shademirk Bog. So, as the gnomes have returned, your broom has seemingly been proven to still function--

lines.text: What would you guys like to do?

As you coast around the outside of this gargantuan tree, you can see there are a number of places where the branches meet and where elements of the bark are slightly split, and there is just a slow, perpetual flow of this black tar-like substance. lines.text: You don't see anything moving around the tree at the moment, other than just the gentle swaying as a little bit of wind hits the sides of it, portions of its long hundreds and hundreds of hanging vines just kind of slowly get moved and tangled by the windfall. lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got a natural 20. Using Luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. So the two twins up there on the broom, as you kind of glance around the other side, you both can see the branches themselves occasionally will shift and curl up, almost like an arm recoiling, and then relax slowly back out again, like a stretching arm held still for too long.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also notice some of the vines that are wrapped around and kind of curled around these branches as well occasionally recoil and pull in and shift and move up, it's like there's a whole ecosystem based around numerous forms of plant life that cause this thing to almost act like a giant organism.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the two of you that are below the treeline, you don't get a grand view above, it's too hard to see, but you guys make your way close to the actual base of the tree?

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Percy, you have to get pretty close to even get a view because of the density of the trees the closer you get to this. So you guys are probably going to have to get within 20, 30 feet to get a view of the exterior of the large tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Can we see him walking towards it?

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a solid trunk in most of its places, but there are swaths of vines that wrap around it and curl and create these giant, tight nets, almost like a Rat King of tails across certain portions of its exterior near the base, and where some of the roots join with the central tree trunk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna back up and try and find a place to scan the ground, find a place to put a door for our mansion.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was doing a tighter loop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of the tree, see if I can get any more details that we haven't already seen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a higher detailed look at it, but once again, you see a number of these vine-clusters around the base of some of these branches, you see elements where the bark has split and sealed over and split again and just spills out more of this black filth.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, although if you find a log approximately two feet thick, I could certainly use that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Requires some cleaning, it is very thick with the actual tar, but you do manage to bring it back to him. A little larger than what you wanted, but it can be carved down.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.text: Those are some nice boots you're wearing, you're probably gonna have to get a new pair when all this is over. It stinks, it's sticky, the muck itself is probably not a very nice conversationalist. It doesn't also from what you can tell appear to be sentient or give you any kind of bad vibe that you can pick up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From looking at it. It is muck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I'll go in and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you gonna turn into?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the time we're just chilling? Okay, well, I'll take a short rest.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you're resting, here amongst the tree tops--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The branches begin to sag ever so slowly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And particularly Keyleth and Percy, actually Grog as well, you begin to feel the branches slowly almost trying to push you off them, like you sort of slide forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I say something? I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. This is horrifying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My potion has worn off, hasn't it?

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both reach, leap for the branch, but you're a good foot and a half, two feet short, and as your fingers catch the edge--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's slick, and both of you go plummeting about 15 feet to the ground. You both suffer four points of falling damage as you catch yourself on the ground, kind of jamming your ankles a little bit. There's a (splash) of liquid as you impact and the lower patch goes partway up your calf, almost to your knee, as you hit and you have to wiggle to try and--

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Sure, we can do that. You don't need a strength check to tie the rope off, we'll just take it. You guys manage to pull yourselves at least out of the muck, however, you've gotta climb up the rope to try and get back in the branches?

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. With that, Scanlan, after leaping onto the next branch, you create the doorway into the mansion up in the trees. You guys all slowly eventually climb back up and get to where the entrance is, and each member of Vox Machina currently present leap into the mansion, to safety, where it's seemingly much more clean, though you are dragging clumps of this liquid on the main carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It resembles, and it's only familiar to you because you've tried this before, it's like tasting the filthiest copper coin you've ever held in a pocket before. It has that kind of metallic residue to it, but also this kind of earthy griminess where it's probably been devoured and digested by a number of creatures before it found its way--

lines.text: It is not pleasant by any means.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you feel evil? More than usual?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give me a little bit and I'll do something to it. I don't really know what I can tell you, but I'll take a look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I need that tree as well, let's take that down to-- want to help me with this before your nap or after?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'll start on it, then you can help when you finish.

lines.text: All right, so you guys begin...

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna come out of the door with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's three inspirations you've just given him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's borderline Lisa Frank quotes here, this is...

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was my footprints you saw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was carrying you all along.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hate you. I hate everything that you stand for. Oh, this is nice. This is, um.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Yeah, you guys take the better part of the next hour to make some loosely functional swamp shoes. They'll get you a short distance, they're not gonna last you a long time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not pretty. They're made of rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All right. So you finish your short rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really wanna swan dive into the muck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like, Keyleth, a swan dive is maybe not the best idea because I feel like it'll make a lot of noise. Maybe nice and quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I tighten my abs and keep my feet together, it shouldn't make much noise at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've been watching a lot of Olympics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have been watching a lot of Olympics.

lines.text: And two spirits trying to hold it for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we take a long rest or just a short rest?

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going for a full long rest after my crap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna go outside with her and just hover on the broom to keep an eye.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going out as well and I'm just sort of shuffling in place and moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you wanna hang out on the broom with me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, that would be better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going into the kitchen with the Titanstone Knuckles, and I'm gonna start hitting things.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a training basement, but okay, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys make your way to the front door, in the distance you can hear a series of dull thuds, bangs, cracks, and various sounds as Grog begins to just punch his way through the entirety of your mansion's kitchen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you wanna check on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just tear through the vicinity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, you're resting up your loins with ice.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: All right, so as you guys step out, Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will you tell me a story?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, as you step off of the tree branch, are you gonna climb down or just leap down into the muck?

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --as gracefully as possible, pull like a Pocahontas, and then turn into the earth elemental as I dive in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you do, your form suddenly ripples and extends out into the form of your elemental body. You slam into the surface and sink down below. You guys see a slight (burble sound) in the liquid, and it leaves this sort of crater of splash that slowly closes up over with no sign of Keyleth now visible on the surface.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I go and I tie one end of it to the heaviest piece of furniture I can find in the foyer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. No heavy furniture per se, but there are a series of large marble pillars that are load-bearing within the interior, and that's probably your best bet, so you go ahead and wrap the rope around that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I use the swirly-whirly knot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. The one that Pike taught you from her sailing days.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the tree, you're going to the tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swimming through the tar itself is a slowing process even as an earth elemental. Earthgliding would mean going subterranean to where the actual physical earth and soil is what you can traverse through. The tar is not natural in comparison to your elemental form, so you'd have to go beneath the actual bog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much further down is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's probably anywhere from three to five feet, depending on certain things, that's to get past how much of it has seeped into the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to move through as you glide in the darkness.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what, we should've definitely tied that rope to her before--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, before she went in, yeah yeah yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wanna use my tremor-sense too to just be aware.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. If I reach and out touch one of the roots, like just run my hand along it, what happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run your hand along the root. It's stiff, the surface of the bark itself is a little rough at the touch. Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry. I just love that word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I move back a little bit, kind of getting away from the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, glide backward, away from that large root that you had run into.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm gonna start making my way back to the mansion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was good, it was good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You earthglide back up, you guys, after waiting a few minutes, suddenly emerging from the bottom of the bog, you see Keyleth's now covered in black tar-like material, her elemental form emerges.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, like the swamp thing? Do I look like the swamp thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She talks. It sounds like a slow-moving rockslide. (rock sounds)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's very poetic. And then I kind of make my way up and drop earth elemental form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little bit's still clinging to the bottom of your robes, but mostly clean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I think it's good, I didn't really see much or learn much more than we already knew.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see any creatures around?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did the muck try to eat you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's only three feet or so deep. I do believe that the tree is living, though. I think its roots were kind of twitching and moving around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you felt the roots, it's not an illusion, it's a real tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Someone taught that to me earlier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just a great word, that's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So with her return, what are you guys gonna do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I guess we should go in and see what going on, what's cooking in the kitchen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys rush into the kitchen, and looking around, you can see now every cabinet's pulled off of its hinges and shattered in half, what was a central stone island is now just a pile of smashed granite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every single possible breakable utensil, platter--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't forget the holes in the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it is just ruin. You see every servant is now on the ground trying to scoop things up, and as soon as they get a handful to go ahead and set it somewhere, just slapped out of their hand by a fist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, what are you doing? This is our kitchen and we need to eat dinner here!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm trying to activate these, and they require pain. (yells)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, what was once a large black cauldron that was used in soup and other sort of base-like liquids, is now, pwang, a large heavy ding is now on the inside in the shape of a fist, and it's half as useful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I notice any difference in the gauntlets?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, because you haven't rested yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I need to hit people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walk in at this point and I'm just looking for some chicken.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you're not an earth elemental anymore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't intend to, but Grog has forgotten that I have a whole training ground downstairs that he could've used. Grog, if you need to hit something, someone, I can give you a few of the servants.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, I've got like a hundred of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys don't mind, do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all turn to you and kinda go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go into the next room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if a change happens, don't you wanna be there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, does your house unbreak itself if Grog breaks it, you know, if it goes away, it poofs and it comes back, is all his damage there or does it--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please. Grog always leaves his mark.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The damage, I believe, I've never seen damage this bad in our place before, but. I believe it will reset. It goes back to normal at the end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We haven't looked at the spa since we destroyed it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I haven't been down to the spa in a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pick up one of the servants by the head and I try and crush his head.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have to try harder, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fix this. You fix this now. I will break more stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought that would work, honestly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is Keyleth still covered in goop?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have any left on you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, he doesn't want you to know this, he told me this the last time you were here, you actually have to do that 33 times before it takes hold, so just keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The servant stands there, its kind of loosely formless face, other than you can see eyes, a nose, and a mouth, but the features are very plain and translucent, just stay wide and staring straight at you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fine, fine. Bring me a cow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The servants vanish and come back, you hear a familiar (dinging).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I hated it when you punched the cow!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going back to my room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's time to ring this bell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is awful. I leave, I can't watch, I go and look for chicken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before you beat this poor senseless cow--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a purple, like, ethereal cow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's still a cow, it's still a cow, don't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm gonna rocky ribs the shit out of this cow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not seem to react in pain as much as (distressed mooing). There's no physical damage seen upon its form, it just gets knocked around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got an idea. I can fix this, Grog, I want you to be a satisfied customer. Let's go downstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I say, you're gonna punch me and keep punching me as long as you can. All right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I transform into a triceratops.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this my day-birth or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, as you hear the growling creature you've never seen before in your life, horns protruding from the front of its bony, armored headpiece, its scaled armored body standing before you, massive, snorting, you just start punching the crap out of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm gonna fight back a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Cause it takes ten minutes of solid punching and missing for Grog to eventually whittle your triceratops hitpoints down to zero. However, in the process, you do manage to get a bit gored, suffering a total of nine points of piercing damage throughout the entirety of this, just little scrapes and scratches, the occasional puncture wound, but eventually you get one solid crack with the gauntlets across his face, and the triceratops form shifts back down to a tiny little Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't hit him, don't hit him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, wait, did it work? Are your gauntlets better or whatever you're trying to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to rest so you can perceive things better. Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No seeming change whatsoever. Although no scarring. The good thing about the gauntlets is that they're powerful enough where all those impacts don't appear to have scratched or dented the surface.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a little sore. That last hit did carry over a little bit, the form didn't absorb the entirety of the blow. You did come back with, uh. Four points of bludgeoning damage to your chin, so you're, you know, a little bit of blood on the corner of your lip that you can taste, and your jaw is a little sore on the right side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for fun while everything's going on, I'm running two passive experiments in my lab while I'm working on the shoes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, and I help him finish the shoes by helping druidcraft them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm leaving some of the muck on some chicken that I took from the kitchen to see if it has any effect on flesh after a long exposure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then I'm distilling some to see if I can even identify anything in there or anything weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what are you guys doing now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have to roll for that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was saying it, but it really happened!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been meaning to try to upgrade Mythcarver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, come get it. Come get it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm gonna do a stab. I'm gonna sing a note and see if this does anything to Mythcarver. I'll just go (sings a note) and I'll try and jam it through his arm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That definitely hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of damage to you, Grog, as the blade kinda sinks about four inches through one of your pectoral muscles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull it out and the blade almost vibrates as it does, it scatters the blood off of its surface as you withdraw it from the wound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I notice any change in the weapon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're only gonna do it once?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah. Do one more, but like, angry-sing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll do some like Black Sabbathy sort of (heavy metal screaming).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take advantage on this one because of your intense singing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A matching wound, this one kind of, (yelps), tickles you a little as it goes a little deeper and kinda tickles the outside of a lung.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I withdraw. And any change?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you withdraw, it kind of rings with the pullback, blood scattered, blade is clean, no noticeable change.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, damn it. All right, forget it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. Wish there was a manual.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have we looked for instructions? Is there writing on the Titanstone Knuckles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are various carvings on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing. I know Common and Gnome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna go up to Grog and cast Cure Wounds at third level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it, you can roll that up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also go ahead and cure myself up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're about to take a rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else do you guys want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, do we have any vague plan, wait, we plan at dawn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanna go upstairs and just open the door and keep an eye out of it for just a little bit and see what I see out the doorway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on! Oh, um. That would be a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. All right. How much time do you spend out there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much time can I spend and still get a good rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I mean, you need an eight-hour rest for a full night's rest, so it depends how much time you want to push off until you begin taking your rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. Well, how about a couple hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second hour, go ahead and make another perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. You do notice a little ways off, some of the tree brush shifts a little bit, and then you see what looks to be a few trees kind of (fwoosh).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemingly there's now a hole in the canopy where once was straight canopy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you think that is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A giant werewolf eating an entire tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is now a hole in the canopy where there was not previously, seemingly the treetops that filled that space have kind of moved out of the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look down underneath us and see if the trees are kind of staying put where we are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and glancing about, nothing is really moving in your vicinity, and the area, the part of the canopy that is now missing, is a pretty large area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It seems bigger than a creature would be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would probably have been the sudden removal or shift of multiple trees to leave that opening in the canopy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe something has trees on its back and moves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But the big scary tree, that's staying still.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was it coming from that direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's still in its place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What direction was it coming from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, it would be kind of southwest from where you are now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the direction we came from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you came southeast, not the direction where you came from, it's still maybe a quarter-mile to a half-mile from where you currently are, so it's not on your path per se.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I roll some hit dice to heal up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, for a full night's rest you're fully healed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I shut the door. That's creepy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You close the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know who I would talk to about that. Can I go find Keyleth, are you asleep yet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I don't think so. I've been helping Percy with his shoes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we're in my room. Making shoes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Okay. So you guys are together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're pretty rough. They're pretty rough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. I'm proud of them, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did pop in briefly to just tell you that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He did that to everybody's room, just in case.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were a bootmaker, that's very true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did start making your own boots, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't ask me to make the boots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I sit down and start playing with the shoes? And, um, ask, Keyleth? Do you know of anything that would cause entire trees to vanish?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I was staring at the door, and all of a sudden, around a space, about three trees just disappeared.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like something really large passed in front of it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, like they dropped, and there's a hole in the canopy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know of anything that would cause that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I know of anything that would cause that? Can I roll a nature check or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would we have learned anything about that in our studies?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe just don't use them anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't know who you pissed off...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're so nice and-- maybe just put them on display! Maybe put them in a really pretty glass case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Make 'em work for you. Make 'em work for you. You paid for that shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trees that are dying and rotting and eventually fall over on their own.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it look like they dropped down, though? Or did it look like they dropped over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just saw them kind of fall out of the canopy, so you're not sure if it was at an angle or straight down or what.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That could be so many things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm assuming it's probably just death-paste, it's just rot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be just congealed decayed matter. It does not have any properties that you can tell on a chemical level at least that stand out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is various types of decayed matter, organic matter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do trees need to live?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And a little bit of minerals and dirt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we're also in the Feywild.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Might not need the same thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might not need the same thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is what it's producing, and it's got to eat something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So Percival, would you imagine that the science of the Feywild, I don't know what that phrase means, would it be the same as our own world? Maybe it follows different rules.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we did see those branches moving like actual limbs on a being as opposed to branches on a tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, nothing here has really been natural.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be like a venus flytrap.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just a hypothesis, but what if the tree's carnivorous. Or omnivorous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that's a very viable option.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you think maybe it's the tree that ate that other group of trees?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be a cannibal tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, the sphinx did say that the bow is the heart of a cancerous tree, I think if we're expecting to not find the tree, we're stupid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does Fenthras mean anything? Fenthras doesn't mean anything, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am the wrong one to ask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no direct translation to it, per se, but its name has hints or at least bases of the ancient elven words for protector and growth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we poison the tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you poison a poisoned tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever it's not used to being exposed to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's not going to be like the crocodile.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it might just laugh poison off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have honey? Can you make honey in your--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you make honey in that jar?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull out the magic jug, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can make fresh water in that jug, though, can't you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've got very little brain, don't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I can make some water if you wanna bless it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not what we're hoping for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, when I was in my earth elemental form, I got up underneath the tree, I mean, I feel like if we needed to, I can get inside of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that could be a very scary prospect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me tell you a tale of two people that went inside a dragon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, I don't think it's much of a cautionary tale, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. If anything, it's a terrible, terrible influence.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I think that's definitely, I think light, I think electricity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, it's not short on water, that's for sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is water in the, was there groundwater of some kind?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, it was sludgy enough. Was there groundwater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there were pockets or some bit of groundwater in there, but a lot of the dense pockets you found were just deeply seated pockets of that sludge-like material that seems to be produced or put out by the nearby roots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you talked to the trees around you, did it seem like they were actually alive, or was it all dead forest that we've been traveling through?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what, the rules here haven't really--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you been talking to any of the trees around here? Right around here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe before we sleep. Can you talk to the nature?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any questions that I might want to figure out before I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the big tree eating you all?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you friends with the big tree? How can we help?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cure the tree, is the tree eating other things, can we cure the tree...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, what if it's a big scary creature, not actually a tree?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the tree have a weakness?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: okay, all right. I'm gonna go step outside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to hang out on the broom so you don't actually step--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're just giving the broom away now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I just don't want anybody to actually stand on a tree for very long.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have to be connected with the ground, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tie a rope around her this time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I jump back in the mud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You land (splash), close to knee-deep in the actual muck below you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna kind of lay back into it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just send things down onto her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you lay there, you slowly sink into it, until you guys just see the outside of Keyleth's face emerge, some of her horned crown sticking out of the muck. A little bit of her chest and her knees and some of the hands emerging, the rest of her is submerged entirely in this muck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You close your eyes and begin reciting the incantation of the spell. You begin to worry as she begins to sink further in, but as she finishes the incantation she stops sinking and it brings her to the surface halfway and keeps her at this balance point there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're just staring out the door down at her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly your consciousness kind of extends into all the nearby, and it's rush because there's just life all around you, life itself is dark, it's twisted, but it is living. What do you wish to ask of the nearby essence?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Um, okay. Can I figure out what is feeding the tree, what the tree, if the tree is consuming things around it, what is fueling the tree?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I sense a lot coming out from the tree, that's clear, can I sense an energy going in towards the tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, your question is, what is feeding the tree? You have to ask a question.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is fueling the tree, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sondur is the only response you get.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get no response, it seems like the question doesn't take hold in the connection, there is no answer to that question. It doesn't consume the question asked as part of the incantation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Remember, we asked if it was an actual tree, if it's an actual tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who is Sondur? That's actually, I should've thought about that, that's a good one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has to relate to the area, terrain, bodies of water, actual information about individuals? The living essence of the forest would not probably know that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Then can I ask the living fauna around me if this tree is sucking life force from them? Is the tree in the middle hurting the plants all around, like for example--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your two questions. You asked one that wasn't effectual, and thus the incantation did not consider it utilized.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the cancerous tree more than just a tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, suddenly, you feel the incantation break its hold with the nearby life sources, you begin to sink once again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Pull her out, pull her out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys pull up as you reach up and grab it, pulling her free from the swampy morass, and carry her back up to the entrance of the mansion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that a band, what is it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that like an elven word?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do any of us recognize the word?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of you recognize the word, but it does sound like a name with elvish background or heritage, or at least some sort of ancient elvish roots to the name structure. It doesn't have specific meaning, but there are names you've heard of people of elven lineage that are plays on a similar sound.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it sound... I mean, what would those names mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I mean, the one that's closest to you is your father's, which is Syldor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, and he's a dick, so the tree probably is too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is how it works. Vex and Vax.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've done a lot of reading of the elven culture. Do you know anything about a Sondur?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no idea. I'm racking my brain and wishing I had access to a library.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a library here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you can have one apparate within the mansion, if you wish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course I have a library! It's in my personal chambers where I do all of my studying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. We have to go to your actual bedroom?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all pornography. Just the entire library is like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like Beauty and the Beast, it's just pornography.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you ask if the tree was just one thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because it was harming the plant life around it. So it's not necessarily all connected, it seems. But it is also definitely not just a tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we, like, salt the earth? That's an expression.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's more than an expression, it's legitimately something you do. Unfortunately, you need salt for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have salt? Do we have lots of salt here in the mansion, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's all over the floor of the kitchen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but we can't bring it out, we can't bring it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have 12 gallons of salt water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't you get a bunch of salt when you jumped into the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if 12 gallons is enough to kill a tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've heard them say it before, they're like, oh, you are the salt of the earth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That wasn't salt, that was something else, and I used it all for the cannonball.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what's our plan? Do we attack this thing with brute force? How do we corrupt the ground? You can turn the ground to stone, will that help anything? Right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's on the other side of this tree? It's huge, it's a hundred feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Inside the tree is the bow. I think if we remove the bow, I think if we find the bow inside the tree, I think that's how--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a lot of tree to search, it could be way up, it could be in a branch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is the legend, at the heart of this tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The heart of this tree. I think we go in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It used to be a titan that had its heart broken or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It says it now acts as the heart to a cancerous tree corrupting the verdant land.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If I were the heart of a tree, I'd be in the center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was a bow that felled the titans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we probably should've done some research on Fenthras before we came out here.

lines.text: It's kind of easy-peasy. I guess anybody could pull this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to have to start doing pushups, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to hit something? Here, I'm--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want to shoot me? I'll be okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not going to shoot you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll be okay, you shot me before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't know what it does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, look at that scar, it's beautiful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we get out of this fucking tree first?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're right, we should probably get out of here, maybe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had not had my coffee, I was tired, there was no bacon...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we are those things. I think we've all learned a lot today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk out of the tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need fresh air. I'm done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it look like outside of the tree? Is the black muck still black mucky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, the whole forest is still just coated in this horrible thick liquid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did, but it wasn't much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But when you approached and you inspected the tree, there was just an ever-constant flow of it, of this thick molasses-type material, just slowly drifting down the tree. You look down and a lot of it seems to have stopped and is hardening, almost like an amber.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, at least it's not burying the forest anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys ready to go home?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm, well. Do we wanna, is there a reason to stay or is it time to go home?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I've seen enough of the Feywild for now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could stop at that hut on the way out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The theater, the theater! What about the theater?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what we could do--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, brother, I think we have other things to attend to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what we could do, Vex'ahlia, we could go about 200 feet away from the hut and you could just--fink!--and see what it does and then we'll shift out of there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody want to climb to the top of the 200-foot tree to see what the rest of the land looks like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear slow clapping from nearby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see sleeveless silk vestments of blue and green billowing freely behind him as he walks up clapping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I instantly case Cure Wounds on myself again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But I am a simple wanderer. An individual who sees the landscape for artistic benefit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It definitely made these past few days absolutely devoid of boredom, at the very least, and filled my sketchbook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is one of my names. I prefer Artagan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I go by many names and many interesting--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I knew I should've asked for that portrait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your journey has come to an end, and I have to be out of here quickly as--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I cast Otiluke's Resilient Sphere on him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I cast Hold Person at the same time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is he? Who is he? What is he?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 'Cause I didn't pull up the Cone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's adorable. So. Where to now? Where's your journey taking you? I take it "this was not your only purpose. Where's your next destination?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We left an empty grave inside, it's got your name on it if you don't talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We go home. And we kill a dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good. They are fickle creatures. They need to be taught a lesson.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd be so kind, I'd like to get on with my day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, one last thing. What is this statue that you tried to steal from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's a companion. You're welcome to keep him with you. I just figured since I was leaving you soon, I'd have someone to wander at my side as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A companion? What does that mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man. That was a ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was good, that was good, Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You avoided the other one, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hut, yes, you avoided the hut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (exasperated noise) Now you grow boring and dreary. I hate boredom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you stay on this plane or do you come with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I stay on this plane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably when you least expect it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good day to you, Puck. Good day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks for the memories. Ah, memories.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, at some point you should ask yourself why we didn't just kill you and why we knew that you were there the whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What, you think I didn't let you find me? Think you could've killed me if you wanted?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorudin I did not know, but I was aware of the enchantment left behind. But who am I to lead a horse to water when you are so determined to drink yourself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That it was. It was great fun. But alas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling we'll meet you again, Artagan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hope so. It does get ever so boring.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll release the sphere on one condition.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We lent it to you, we want it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm happy to give it to you, but I'm apparently trapped in this sphere of magic."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll let you go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Vax. Was this yours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And maybe visit. If you get lonely." And he gives a deep bow and just vanishes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dear god, let's get out of here before something else happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone hold hands and say Kumbaya.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's go back to our plane.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't want to see the ex?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've dealt with enough scorned lovers for one day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are we doing, we're warping out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold your hands up, brother, we're holding your hands.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I'm tangling my fingers up, if she'll let me, with Keyleth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And say, just quietly to the side, You know, you've been pretty fucking amazing lately. As usual.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say, You haven't been quite bad, yourself. And then we go to Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll end tonight's session.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ahh, there's the card, there's the card.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, that guy tried to act like he knew you. Fuck that shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He had so many things wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The item list that you found--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does it do, what does it do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay. +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. 1d4 lightning damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. Target takes an additional 4d8 piercing damage, plus they have to make a strength saving throw or be restrained.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, this is so cool! Once per short rest, I can use an Oracle Shot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can project my sight through my arrow that I fire from it, for up to ten minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Imagine from the broom up high how far that arrow would go. And then when a creature is killed by an arrow from this weapon, a single six-foot tree grows out of their corpse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depending on the time of year, it may be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't need the Onyx Dog, why don't I hold onto that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, no, I wanna see what it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can we talk about that dog? Can we talk about it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll for it. Roll for it, bro.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: More animals. More animals for Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't wanna keep it, I just wanna, I'm the one holding onto it, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll have to tune in next Thursday to see what it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stay tuned for another episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the end of this episode, we'll be back next Thursday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you Lootcrate for your awesome sponsorship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ask you all: Is it Thursday yet?
